Description: Shoulder sherd of Milesian Fikellura pottery neck-amphora; white slip; exterior: black on ridge at join of neck and shoulder; at top of shoulder band of narrow tongues above broken cable pattern between bands of short vertical strokes; trace of undetermined motif at bottom of sherd.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Simple broken cable patterns such as the one seen on the shoulder of the neck amphora are rare but another example is found in British Museum 1861,0425.47 from Kamiros which Cook (1933-1934, p. 16-7, no. 12) placed in his Altenburg Group. For parallels regarding the decoration, see Alexandria 17171.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 42, no. 153 pl. 37)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 248, no. 5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.030)
